    torch.save(network, '%s/model-%s-%s.pkl' % (params.savedir, params.name, epoch))

body:
Douwe Kiela reports:

After registering a backward hook, when saving checkpoints, I get:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 472, in <module>
    torch.save(network, '%s/model-%s-%s.pkl' % (params.savedir, params.name, epoch))
  File "/home/dkiela/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 120, in save
    return _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol)
  File "/home/dkiela/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 186, in _save
    pickler.dump(obj)
cPickle.PicklingError: Can't pickle <type 'function'>: attribute lookup __builtin__.function failed
```
